channel.title: Kidstuff on Konigi
channel.description: Recent content in Kidstuff on Konigi

item.title: PBS Learning
item.description: Free standards-aligned videos, interactives, lesson plans, and more just for California teachers and students.

item.title: Khan Academy
item.description: Free remote learning courses for students of all ages.

item.title: Mystery Science
item.description: Free, easy K-5 science lessons for remote learning.

item.title: Prodigy Math Game
item.description: Free math game for elementary school kids that adapts in difficulty to suit your child’s learning style and grade level.

item.title: Raz Kids
item.description: K-5 site with 400+ eBooks that students can listen to, read, and even record themselves reading.

item.title: Keyboarding Without Tears
item.description: Keyboarding practice app for elementary school kids.

item.title: Author Read Alouds on YouTube
item.description: The Children’s Book Council’s playlist of authors reading their books aloud.

item.title: Bookflix on Schoolastic
item.description: Scholastic BookFlix is a literacy resource that pairs classic video storybooks from Weston Woods with related nonfiction eBooks from Scholastic.

item.title: Celebrity Read Alouds on Storyline
item.description: Storyline Online, streams videos featuring celebrated actors reading childrenâ€™s books alongside creatively produced illustrations. Readers include Viola Davis, Chris Pine, Lily Tomlin, Kevin Costner, Annette Bening, James Earl Jones, Betty White and more.

item.title: BrainPOP
item.description: BrainPOP is an excellent learning resource for teaching resource for kids K - 8th grade and offers free access during school closures.

item.title: Epic! Digital Library
item.description: Digital Library for kids 12 & under. Free access through your school.

item.title: Learn@Home on YouTube
item.description: YouTube, Khan Academy and other learning creators partner to bring together resources and activities to make days as educational and fun as possible.
